title: Implement Designer tool for creating CNC designs and generating G-code
description:
Create an integrated CAD/CAM Designer tool that allows users to design CNC projects visually and generate G-code directly within GCodeKit4.

Vision:
- Visual design tool for creating 2D/2.5D CNC projects
- Intuitive drawing and editing interface
- Parametric design capabilities
- Direct G-code generation from designs
- Library of common shapes and operations

Core Features:

1. **Drawing Tools**
   - Basic shapes: Rectangle, Circle, Ellipse, Polygon
   - Line and arc drawing (straight, arc, bezier)
   - Text tool with multiple fonts (engrave or pocket)
   - Boolean operations (union, subtract, intersect)
   - Path editing and manipulation
   - Snap-to-grid and object snapping
   - Measurement and dimensioning tools

2. **Design Operations**
   - Offset paths (inward/outward)
   - Array operations (linear, circular, grid)
   - Mirror and rotate
   - Scale and transform
   - Chamfer and fillet
   - Path smoothing and optimization
   - Layer management

3. **Toolpath Generation**
   - Contour/profile operations
   - Pocket operations (with island support)
   - Drilling operations
   - Engraving operations
   - V-carving support
   - Adaptive clearing
   - Multiple pass depth control
   - Stepover and stepdown settings

4. **Tool Library**
   - Define tool geometry (diameter, type, flutes)
   - Cutting parameters (feed rate, plunge rate, RPM)
   - Tool change management
   - Tool path simulation
   - Tool wear compensation
   - Material-specific settings

5. **Work Setup**
   - Material dimensions and origin
   - Fixture/holding setup
   - Multiple work coordinate systems (G54-G59)
   - Safe Z height configuration
   - Rapid positioning settings
   - Collision detection zones

6. **G-Code Generation**
   - Post-processor selection (GRBL, TinyG, etc.)
   - Custom post-processor scripting
   - G-code preview and verification
   - Toolpath optimization
   - Estimate machining time
   - Generate setup sheets

7. **File Management**
   - Save/load design projects (.gk4design format)
   - Import DXF, SVG, and other vector formats
   - Export G-code with multiple post-processors
   - Export toolpath visualization
   - Template library for common projects

8. **User Interface**
   - Canvas with zoom, pan, rotate
   - Property panel for selected objects
   - Layers panel for organization
   - Operations tree view
   - Real-time preview with shading
   - Units support (metric/imperial)

Technical Implementation:

**UI Framework:**
- Slint canvas widget for 2D drawing
- Custom rendering for shapes and toolpaths
- Interactive manipulation handles
- Context-sensitive property editors

**Geometry Engine:**
- 2D computational geometry library (geo crate or similar)
- Path offsetting and boolean operations
- Arc/spline approximation
- Intersection and collision detection

**CAM Engine:**
- Toolpath generation algorithms
- Pocket clearing strategies (zigzag, spiral, adaptive)
- Contour following with lead-in/lead-out
- Drilling pattern generation
- Simulation of material removal

**G-Code Generator:**
- Modular post-processor system
- Template-based code generation
- Support for multiple controller dialects
- Comment and annotation support

**Data Model:**
- Design document structure
- Parametric object definitions
- Operation history for undo/redo
- Layer and group management

Phased Implementation:

**Phase 1: Basic Drawing (MVP)**
- Canvas with zoom/pan
- Basic shapes (rectangle, circle, line)
- Object selection and manipulation
- Simple contour toolpath generation
- G-code export for GRBL

**Phase 2: Advanced Drawing**
- Bezier curves and splines
- Text support
- Boolean operations
- Path editing tools
- Layer management

**Phase 3: CAM Operations**
- Pocket operations
- Drilling patterns
- Tool library
- Multiple pass support
- Toolpath simulation

**Phase 4: Advanced Features**
- Import DXF/SVG
- Parametric designs
- Array operations
- V-carving
- Adaptive clearing

**Phase 5: Polish & Integration**
- Template library
- Custom post-processors
- Design validation
- Integration with visualizer
- Performance optimization

User Workflows:

1. **Simple Pocket:**
   - Draw rectangle outline
   - Select pocket operation
   - Choose tool and parameters
   - Generate G-code

2. **Text Engraving:**
   - Add text object
   - Set font and size
   - Choose engraving tool
   - Generate V-carve or contour path

3. **Multi-Operation Project:**
   - Import DXF design
   - Define multiple operations (drill, pocket, contour)
   - Assign tools to each operation
   - Simulate complete job
   - Generate optimized G-code

Benefits:
- All-in-one solution (design + control)
- No need for external CAD/CAM software
- Integrated workflow from design to machining
- Optimized G-code for target controller
- Lower barrier to entry for beginners
- Quick prototyping and iteration

Success Criteria:
- Users can create basic 2D designs without external tools
- Generate working G-code for common operations
- Intuitive UI that doesn't require CAM expertise
- Performance: Handle designs with 1000+ objects smoothly
- Integration: Seamlessly move from design to machining

Related Issues:
- gcodekit4-8 (Future phases planning)
- CAM integration mentioned in Phase 8+ potential areas

title: Implement CAM Tools Palette for storing and managing cutting tools
description:
Create a comprehensive CAM Tools Palette system for defining, organizing, and managing cutting tools with their parameters, geometry, and cutting characteristics.

Vision:
- Centralized tool library for all CNC operations
- Pre-defined tools for common operations
- Custom tool creation and management
- Tool parameter templates and presets
- Material-specific cutting recommendations
- Integration with Designer and G-code generation

Core Features:

1. **Tool Definition**
   - Tool identification (number, name, description)
   - Tool type classification:
     * End mills (flat, ball, corner radius)
     * V-bits (various angles: 60°, 90°, 120°)
     * Drill bits (twist, spot, center)
     * Engraving tools (diamond, carbide)
     * Specialty tools (chamfer, dovetail, thread mill)
   - Geometry parameters:
     * Diameter (cutting diameter, shaft diameter)
     * Length (overall length, flute length, reach)
     * Number of flutes (1-4+)
     * Helix angle
     * Corner radius (for corner radius end mills)
     * Point angle (for drills and v-bits)
     * Tip diameter (for v-bits)
   - Material specifications:
     * Tool material (HSS, carbide, coated carbide, diamond)
     * Coating type (TiN, TiAlN, diamond-like carbon)
     * Shank type (straight, tapered, collet size)

2. **Cutting Parameters**
   - Spindle speed (RPM) - min/max/recommended
   - Feed rate (mm/min or in/min) - by material
   - Plunge rate (typically slower than feed rate)
   - Stepover (percentage of tool diameter or absolute)
   - Stepdown/Depth per pass (multiple passes)
   - Ramp angle for entry moves
   - Lead-in/lead-out distances
   - Chip load calculations

3. **Material-Specific Settings**
   - Create material profiles:
     * Hardwoods (oak, maple, walnut)
     * Softwoods (pine, cedar, balsa)
     * Plastics (acrylic, HDPE, PVC, polycarbonate)
     * Metals (aluminum, brass, copper, steel)
     * Composites (MDF, plywood, carbon fiber)
   - Recommended parameters per material:
     * RPM range
     * Feed rates
     * Depth of cut
     * Finish pass settings
   - Coolant/lubrication requirements
   - Surface finish expectations

4. **Tool Organization**
   - Categories and subcategories:
     * By type (end mills, drills, v-bits, etc.)
     * By material (wood, plastic, metal)
     * By operation (roughing, finishing, engraving)
     * By diameter range
   - Custom collections/favorites
   - Import/export tool libraries
   - Search and filter capabilities
   - Sort by various criteria

5. **Tool Library Management**
   - Add new tools (manual or from presets)
   - Edit existing tool parameters
   - Duplicate tools for variations
   - Delete unused tools
   - Bulk operations (import/export)
   - Version control for tool libraries
   - Backup and restore

6. **Integration Points**
   - **Designer Tool:**
     * Select tool from palette for operations
     * Preview tool geometry in design view
     * Tool-specific operation suggestions
     * Automatic parameter population
   - **G-Code Generation:**
     * Tool change commands (M6)
     * Spindle speed commands (M3/M4)
     * Feed rate optimization
     * Tool compensation (G41/G42)
   - **Visualizer:**
     * Display current tool in use
     * Show tool paths with tool preview
     * Simulate material removal with tool geometry

7. **Tool Validation & Safety**
   - Parameter validation (reasonable ranges)
   - Compatibility checks (tool vs. material)
   - Collision detection (tool length vs. work height)
   - Feed rate limits based on machine capabilities
   - Warning for aggressive parameters
   - Safety factor calculations

8. **Presets & Templates**
   - Standard tool library included:
     * Common 1/8" and 1/4" end mills
     * Standard drill bit sets
     * Popular v-bit angles
     * Metric equivalents
   - Material-optimized presets
   - Import from popular CAM software formats
   - Community-shared tool libraries
   - Manufacturer tool databases

9. **Tool Life Tracking** (Advanced)
   - Track tool usage time
   - Estimate tool wear
   - Maintenance scheduling
   - Replacement reminders
   - Cost tracking per tool
   - Historical performance data

10. **Documentation & Help**
    - Tool selection guide
    - Feed and speed calculators
    - Material recommendations
    - Best practices tips
    - Tutorial videos/guides
    - Troubleshooting common issues

Data Model:

```rust
struct Tool {
    id: ToolId,
    name: String,
    tool_number: u32,
    description: String,
    category: ToolCategory,
    
    // Geometry
    diameter: f64,              // mm
    shaft_diameter: Option<f64>,
    length: f64,
    flute_length: f64,
    flutes: u32,
    corner_radius: Option<f64>,
    tip_angle: Option<f64>,     // degrees
    
    // Material
    material: ToolMaterial,
    coating: Option<ToolCoating>,
    
    // Cutting parameters (defaults)
    default_rpm: u32,
    rpm_range: (u32, u32),      // min, max
    
    // Material-specific settings
    material_settings: HashMap<Material, CuttingParameters>,
    
    // Metadata
    manufacturer: Option<String>,
    part_number: Option<String>,
    cost: Option<f64>,
    notes: String,
    
    // Usage tracking
    total_time: Duration,
    last_used: Option<DateTime>,
}

struct CuttingParameters {
    rpm: u32,
    feed_rate: f64,             // mm/min
    plunge_rate: f64,           // mm/min
    stepover_percent: f64,      // percentage of diameter
    depth_per_pass: f64,        // mm
    finish_pass_depth: Option<f64>,
}
```

User Interface:

**Tools Palette Panel:**
- Sidebar panel (collapsible)
- Tool browser with thumbnails
- Category filters
- Search box
- Quick access to favorites
- Tool preview with specs
- "Add Tool" button

**Tool Editor Dialog:**
- Tabbed interface:
  * General (name, number, type)
  * Geometry (dimensions, flutes)
  * Parameters (speeds, feeds)
  * Materials (per-material settings)
  * Advanced (tracking, notes)
- Visual tool preview
- Parameter validation
- Save/Cancel buttons

**Tool Selector Widget:**
- Used in Designer operations
- Dropdown or searchable list
- Shows key specs in preview
- Quick "Edit" button
- Recent/favorite tools highlighted

File Format:

**.gk4tools (Tool Library File):**
- JSON or TOML format
- Human-readable
- Version controlled
- Supports comments
- Example:
```toml
[tool.1]
name = "1/4 inch Flat End Mill"
number = 1
type = "end_mill_flat"
diameter = 6.35
flutes = 2
length = 50.0
material = "carbide"

[tool.1.wood_hardwood]
rpm = 18000
feed_rate = 1500
stepover = 40.0
depth_per_pass = 3.0
```

Implementation Phases:

**Phase 1: Core Library**
- Basic tool data structure
- Add/edit/delete tools
- Simple list view
- Save/load tool libraries

**Phase 2: Parameters & Materials**
- Material-specific cutting parameters
- Parameter validation
- Feed/speed calculations
- Tool preview rendering

**Phase 3: Organization & Search**
- Categories and collections
- Search and filter
- Favorites system
- Import/export

**Phase 4: Integration**
- Connect to Designer tool
- G-code generation integration
- Visualizer tool display
- Parameter auto-population

**Phase 5: Advanced Features**
- Tool life tracking
- Presets and templates
- Community library
- Usage analytics

Success Criteria:
- Users can define and save custom tools
- Tool parameters integrate with Designer operations
- Library includes 50+ common tools out of box
- Tool selection is intuitive and quick
- Parameters are validated and safe
- Libraries can be shared between users

Benefits:
- Consistent tool definitions across projects
- Eliminate parameter entry errors
- Material-optimized cutting parameters
- Faster workflow (no manual parameter lookup)
- Knowledge base of proven tool/material combos
- Professional toolpath generation

Related Issues:
- gcodekit4-10 (Designer tool - primary consumer)
- gcodekit4-8 (Phase 8+ planning - CAM integration)

title: Implement CAM Tools Palette for storing and managing cutting tools
Implement Materials Database with CAM tools integration
description:
Create a comprehensive Materials Database that links with CAM tools to provide material-specific machining parameters, properties, and recommendations.

Vision:
- Centralized database of CNC materials (woods, plastics, metals, composites)
- Material properties and characteristics
- Recommended cutting parameters per material
- Bidirectional integration with CAM Tools Palette
- Material selection guides and best practices
- User-extensible with custom materials

Core Features:

1. **Material Categories & Types**
   
   **Woods:**
   - Hardwoods: Oak, Maple, Walnut, Cherry, Ash, Birch
   - Softwoods: Pine, Cedar, Spruce, Fir, Redwood, Balsa
   - Engineered: MDF, Plywood, Particleboard, OSB, LDF
   - Exotic: Teak, Mahogany, Rosewood, Ebony, Zebrawood
   
   **Plastics:**
   - Acrylics: PMMA, Plexiglass, Lucite
   - Engineering: ABS, PVC, HDPE, LDPE, Polycarbonate, Nylon
   - Specialty: Delrin (POM), PEEK, PTFE (Teflon), Ultem
   - Foams: EPS, XPS, EVA, Polyurethane
   
   **Metals:**
   - Non-ferrous: Aluminum (6061, 7075), Brass, Copper, Bronze
   - Ferrous: Mild Steel, Stainless Steel, Tool Steel
   - Precious: Gold, Silver, Platinum (jewelry)
   - Specialty: Titanium, Magnesium
   
   **Composites:**
   - Carbon Fiber
   - Fiberglass (G10/FR4)
   - Phenolic
   - Kevlar
   
   **Stone & Ceramics:**
   - Marble, Granite, Soapstone
   - Corian, Tile, Glass

2. **Material Properties**
   
   **Physical Properties:**
   - Density (g/cm³ or kg/m³)
   - Hardness (Brinell, Rockwell, Janka for wood)
   - Tensile strength
   - Compressive strength
   - Melting point / Glass transition temperature
   - Thermal conductivity
   - Coefficient of thermal expansion
   
   **Machining Properties:**
   - Machinability rating (1-10 scale)
   - Chip formation characteristics
   - Tendency to work harden
   - Surface finish achievability
   - Burr formation tendency
   - Heat sensitivity
   - Abrasiveness (tool wear factor)
   
   **Safety & Handling:**
   - Dust hazards (toxicity, flammability)
   - Fume hazards when cutting
   - Required PPE (Personal Protective Equipment)
   - Coolant/lubrication requirements
   - Static electricity concerns
   - Fire/explosion risks
   - Disposal requirements

3. **Cutting Parameter Recommendations**
   
   **For Each Material:**
   - RPM ranges by tool type and diameter
   - Feed rate ranges (roughing vs. finishing)
   - Plunge rate recommendations
   - Depth of cut (DOC) guidelines
   - Stepover percentages
   - Climb vs. conventional milling preference
   - Optimal chip load by tool size
   - Finish pass parameters
   
   **Tool-Material Matrix:**
   - Best tool types for material
   - Tool geometry recommendations (helix angle, flutes)
   - Tool material selection (HSS vs. Carbide)
   - Coating recommendations (TiN, TiAlN for metals)
   - Tool life expectancy
   
   **Operation-Specific:**
   - Contour cutting parameters
   - Pocket clearing strategies
   - Drilling recommendations
   - Engraving settings
   - V-carving depths

4. **Material Selection & Guidance**
   
   **Selection Wizard:**
   - Filter by category
   - Filter by properties (hardness, strength)
   - Filter by machining difficulty
   - Search by name or characteristics
   - Compare materials side-by-side
   
   **Recommendations:**
   - "Similar materials" suggestions
   - "Easier alternatives" for beginners
   - Cost considerations
   - Availability information
   - Typical applications/uses
   
   **Best Practices:**
   - Workholding recommendations
   - Dust collection requirements
   - Finishing techniques
   - Common issues and solutions
   - Tips and tricks per material

5. **Integration with CAM Tools Palette**
   
   **Bidirectional Linking:**
   - Material → Recommended tools
   - Tool → Compatible materials
   - Auto-populate parameters when tool + material selected
   - Override warnings for non-optimal combinations
   
   **Smart Parameter Selection:**
   - When user selects material in Designer:
     * Suggest appropriate tools from palette
     * Auto-fill cutting parameters
     * Display material warnings/notes
   - When user selects tool:
     * Show compatible materials
     * Highlight optimal materials
     * Display parameter adjustments needed
   
   **Parameter Validation:**
   - Warn if parameters outside recommended range
   - Flag aggressive settings for material
   - Suggest parameter corrections
   - Calculate safety factors

6. **Custom Materials & User Extensions**
   
   **Add Custom Materials:**
   - User-defined material entries
   - Clone existing and modify
   - Full property editing
   - Custom cutting parameters
   - Private or shareable
   
   **Community Library:**
   - Share custom materials
   - Import community materials
   - Rate and review materials
   - Update from community
   
   **Material Testing:**
   - Record test cut results
   - Iterate parameters
   - Save successful combinations
   - Build knowledge base

7. **Material Cost & Inventory** (Advanced)
   
   **Cost Tracking:**
   - Price per unit (board foot, sheet, kg)
   - Supplier information
   - Cost estimation for projects
   - Material waste calculations
   
   **Inventory Management:**
   - Track material stock
   - Low stock alerts
   - Reorder reminders
   - Usage history
   - Material expiration (for adhesives, resins)

8. **Documentation & Resources**
   
   **Per Material:**
   - Datasheet/specification sheet
   - Safety Data Sheet (SDS)
   - Machining guide
   - Video tutorials
   - External reference links
   
   **General Resources:**
   - Material selection guide
   - Troubleshooting common issues
   - Feeds and speeds calculator
   - Chip load calculator
   - Tool life estimator

Data Model:

```rust
struct Material {
    id: MaterialId,
    name: String,
    category: MaterialCategory,
    subcategory: String,
    
    // Properties
    density: f64,              // kg/m³
    hardness: Hardness,
    machinability_rating: u8,  // 1-10
    
    // Physical properties
    tensile_strength: Option<f64>,
    melting_point: Option<f64>,
    thermal_expansion: Option<f64>,
    
    // Machining characteristics
    chip_formation: ChipType,
    heat_sensitivity: HeatSensitivity,
    abrasiveness: Abrasiveness,
    surface_finish: SurfaceFinishability,
    
    // Safety
    dust_hazard: HazardLevel,
    fume_hazard: HazardLevel,
    required_ppe: Vec<PPE>,
    coolant_required: bool,
    
    // Cutting parameters by tool type
    cutting_params: HashMap<ToolType, MaterialCuttingParams>,
    
    // Tool compatibility
    recommended_tools: Vec<ToolId>,
    incompatible_tools: Vec<ToolId>,
    
    // Metadata
    cost_per_unit: Option<f64>,
    suppliers: Vec<Supplier>,
    typical_applications: Vec<String>,
    notes: String,
    
    // User data
    custom: bool,
    user_rating: Option<u8>,
    test_results: Vec<TestResult>,
}

struct MaterialCuttingParams {
    rpm_range: (u32, u32),
    feed_rate_range: (f64, f64),
    plunge_rate_factor: f64,    // Percentage of feed rate
    max_doc: f64,                // Maximum depth of cut
    stepover_percent: (f64, f64), // Min, max
    finish_pass_params: FinishParams,
    coolant_type: Option<CoolantType>,
}
```

User Interface:

**Materials Panel:**
- Tree view by category
- Material cards with key properties
- Search and filter tools
- "Add Material" button
- Favorites/recent materials

**Material Editor:**
- Tabbed interface:
  * General (name, category, description)
  * Properties (physical, mechanical)
  * Machining (parameters by tool type)
  * Safety (hazards, PPE, handling)
  * Tools (recommended, compatible)
  * Resources (docs, links, notes)
- Preview of material swatch/photo
- Parameter validation
- Save/Export options

**Material Selector Widget:**
- Used in Designer when setting up projects
- Shows material name, category, key properties
- Quick access to parameters
- Material warnings/notes display
- Link to full material details

**Tool-Material Matrix View:**
- Grid showing tools vs. materials
- Color-coded compatibility
- Click cell to see specific parameters
- Export matrix for reference

File Format:

**.gk4materials (Materials Library File):**
- JSON or TOML format
- Example:
```toml
[material.oak_red]
name = "Red Oak"
category = "wood_hardwood"
density = 750.0
hardness = { janka = 1290 }
machinability = 8

[material.oak_red.endmill_flat]
rpm_range = [16000, 20000]
feed_rate_range = [1200, 2000]
max_doc = 6.0
stepover_percent = [40, 60]
```

Implementation Phases:

**Phase 1: Core Database**
- Material data structure
- Basic material library (20-30 common materials)
- CRUD operations
- Simple list view

**Phase 2: Properties & Parameters**
- Full property definitions
- Cutting parameter matrices
- Safety information
- Material preview

**Phase 3: Integration**
- Link with CAM Tools Palette
- Auto-parameter population
- Compatibility validation
- Smart suggestions

**Phase 4: Advanced Features**
- Custom materials
- Community sharing
- Cost tracking
- Inventory management

**Phase 5: Documentation & Tools**
- Comprehensive material guides
- Calculators (feeds, speeds, chip load)
- Video tutorials
- Interactive selection wizard

Success Criteria:
- Database includes 100+ materials at launch
- All common woods, plastics, and aluminum covered
- Integration with tools palette is seamless
- Parameters automatically populate from material selection
- Users can add and share custom materials
- Material selection improves cutting quality

Benefits:
- Eliminates guesswork in parameter selection
- Reduces tool breakage and material waste
- Improves surface finish quality
- Faster project setup
- Knowledge base of proven combinations
- Educational resource for learning CNC

Related Issues:
- gcodekit4-11 (CAM Tools Palette - primary integration)
- gcodekit4-10 (Designer tool - material selection)
- gcodekit4-8 (Future phases planning)

title: Analyze and fix communication system blocking UI events during file transmission
description:
Investigate and resolve UI blocking/freezing issues that occur when sending G-code files to the device through the communication system.

Problem:
- UI becomes unresponsive during G-code file transmission
- Events are blocked or delayed while sending large files
- User cannot interact with the interface during send operations
- Application appears to hang or freeze

Current Implementation:
- Communication happens on separate threads
- UI updates via Slint event loop
- Timer-based state machine for non-blocking sends (implemented in v0.24.1)
- Character-counting protocol for GRBL flow control

Investigation Areas:

1. **Thread Communication**
   - Review message passing between communication threads and UI
   - Check for blocking operations in UI thread
   - Analyze std::sync::mpsc channel usage
   - Verify proper use of window.invoke_from_event_loop()

2. **Send Operation Flow**
   - Examine send_to_device implementation
   - Review file chunking and batching strategy
   - Check for synchronous operations that should be async
   - Analyze acknowledgment tracking logic

3. **UI Event Loop Integration**
   - Verify Slint timer usage and frequency
   - Check for long-running operations in callbacks
   - Review window.invoke_from_event_loop() placement
   - Ensure UI updates don't block on I/O

4. **Resource Contention**
   - Check for mutex/lock contention
   - Analyze shared state access patterns
   - Review Arc<Mutex<T>> usage
   - Identify potential deadlocks

5. **Message Queue Management**
   - Review channel buffer sizes
   - Check for queue overflow conditions
   - Analyze message processing rate
   - Verify proper backpressure handling

Expected Behavior:
- UI remains fully responsive during file sends
- User can cancel send operations at any time
- Progress updates without UI freezing
- Other UI controls remain functional
- Console messages display in real-time

Potential Solutions:
1. Move more work off UI thread
2. Reduce message passing frequency
3. Batch UI updates more efficiently
4. Use async/await for I/O operations
5. Implement proper backpressure
6. Add yield points in long operations
7. Use dedicated worker threads for heavy tasks

Success Criteria:
- UI responds to user input during sends (<100ms latency)
- Progress bar updates smoothly
- Console messages appear in real-time
- Cancel button works immediately
- No perceived freezing or hanging
- All functionality remains accessible during transmission

Related:
- v0.24.1 timer-based state machine implementation
- Character-counting protocol for GRBL
- UI timeout fixes previously implemented
